text: Giovanni Maria Tamburini (flourished 17th century) was an Italian painter of the Baroque period. ==Biography== He was initially a pupil of Pietro Faccini, and then of Guido Reni in Bologna. He painted for several of the churches in Bologna. He painted a St. Antony of Padua for the church of Santa Maria della Morte, and an Annunciation for Sanctuary of Santa Maria della Vita. ==References== * * Category:17th-century Italian painters Category:Italian male painters Category:Bolognese painters Category:Italian Baroque painters Category:People from Bologna Category:Italian engravers Category:Year of death missing Category:Year of birth missing
title: Giovanni Maria Tamburini
